column1: Příbor (Czech pronunciation: [ˈpr̝̊iːbor]; German: Freiberg in Mähren) is a town in Nový Jičín District in the Moravian-Silesian Region of the Czech Republic. It has about 8
column2: 500 inhabitants. The historic centre of Příbor is well preserved and historically significant and is protected by law as Urban monument reservation.

column1: Příbor is located in northeastern Moravia
column2: and is surrounded by the foothills of the Moravian-Silesian Beskids.

column1: Villages of Hájov and Prchalov are administrative parts of Nový Jičín.
Vriburch in the Margraviate of Moravia was first mentioned in a 1251 deed
column2: issued by the Přemyslid margrave Ottokar II. The estates passed to the Bishops of Olomouc in the 14th century. Saint John Sarkander attended the local parish school from 1589; in 1694 a Piarist gymnasium was established
column3: whereafter Příbor developed to a centre of education.

column2: Austrian neurologist and the founder of psychoanalysis; a museum is at his family home
